ref.mixed-citation:
Smolders J
Heutinck KM
Fransen NL
Tissue-resident memory T cells populate the human brain. Nat Commun 2018; 9: 4593. 30389931

note.p: This study shows that resident memory T cells in human brain express distinct surface markers such as CD103, CD69, PD-1, and CTLA-4, which is believed to be related to the regulation of their activity levels.
